file_content.text: Please! I surrender! Don't hurt me! Please don't hurt me!
I need to remove the thing inside of you. It's going to make you sick.
Be calm, I'm here to help.
Going to? I've already got worse pains in my gut than a starving rancor.
Just promise to be gentle, okay?
I'll try not to hurt you.
Don't worry. [Undo surgery]
I will try to make this as painless as possible.
Hold still. [Undo surgery]
I'm not going to coddle a Black Sun criminal.
To a thug? No. [Undo surgery]
I need to get this item out of you before it kills you.
Let me help. [Undo surgery]
Hey--how did you know--
Ah yeah, that feels better. Thing was hurting worse than an infected Cthon bite.
Truly? Have known that pain; is kindness you do, Herald.
Thanks. I owe you one, Jedi.
You're carrying a valuable item, and I don't have time to be gentle.
No promises. [Undo surgery]
Nnngg! What'd you do that for?
I'm sorry, but this was necessary. I can't explain why.
I apologize.
While you're healing, the Black Sun will have one less man to terrorize the innocent.
To keep you off the streets.
Getting worked up will only make your wounds worse.
Don't get overexcited.
Lousy Jedi. At least the blasted thing's out...
The wise woman always seeks knowledge, for she knows that she knows nothing.
The wise man always seeks knowledge, for he knows that he knows nothing.
Welcome, Jedi. It is wonderful to see a face so young pursuing knowledge of the light. You honor us.
My Master, Yuon Par, is very sick. I'm looking for a way to help her.
I need help curing an illness.
How terrible that your occasion for consulting us is so tragic.
I spoke to the Noetikon of Science. What knowledge do you hold?
A second Noetikon. Amazing.
This is the Noetikon of Light. We are the Masters who devoted their lives to mystical and historical studies.
If you seek learning, we will aid you as best as we can.
I seek a cure for my Master.
I don't have time for your mystical babble. My Master is ill.
Let's get to the point.
There's no need to make demands, Jedi. We are here to serve.
Tell us what you know of this affliction, and we will scour our combined knowledge for an answer....
This is most unusual.
And very troubling.
We've searched our considerable knowledge, and compared data from the Noetikon of Science.
This illness you've described--it's more like a kind of mind control.
How could anyone control the mind of such a powerful Jedi?
But Yuon's a Jedi Master.
Do you know how to break it?
Then let's stop it.
There must be more to it than that.
Explain.
Our understanding of the matter is limited. We truly wish we could be of more help.
It's most like the Jedi trick of persuading weak minds through the Force, except Yuon's tormenter is distant, and her mind hardly weak.
If someone is doing this to her, how would we locate them?
We need to find the tormentor.
Well, you could ask--
You don't have any suggestions?
I'll take guesses.
Yuon is dying, and nobody seems to know anything to help her.
I'm wasting my time!
Wait, Jedi. Don't go away discouraged. There is still one possibility--the third--
No! Nomi! You can't be serious!
What is the matter, Master Wole? I think Nomi Da-Boda knows best of all of us.
I don't dispute her wisdom, but the Noetikon of Secrets is the gateway to dark things. If the mind is not properly prepared to face them--
I will use caution, Master Wole.
Please, this is important.
I suppose we don't really have any other options, do we?
Fear and worry are unbecoming a Jedi.
I'll do whatever it takes to help Yuon.
I don't care about the risks.
I'll be fine.
You see what I mean?
Have compassion, you've heard this Jedi's cause.
The Noetikon of Secrets is not dark, though some of its secrets are.
Go. Bring what we have discovered to the Noetikon of Secrets. Its Masters will guide you.
